org.simplity.kernel.dm

Class Record

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.kernel.dm.Record
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component

    public class Record
extends Object
implements Component
    This is the main part of our data model. Every piece of data that the application has to keep as part of "system of records" must be modeled into this. Data structures that are used as input to, or output from a service are modeled as records as well. It is common industry practice to have "physical data model" and "logical data model" for proper understanding. We encourage such designs before recording them using the Record concept. Record is a good candidate to represent any data structure that is used across components, even if it is not persisted.

        getSimpleName in interface Component
        Returns:
        simple name, with no prefix (module). Component name is unique within a module, but may not be across modules. Hence a moduleName is to be used to refer to a components

      • createSheet

        public DataSheet createSheet(boolean forSingleRow,
                             boolean addActionColumn)
        create an empty data sheet based on this record
        Parameters:
        forSingleRow - true if you intend to store only one row. False otherwise
        addActionColumn - should we add a column to have action to be performed on each row
        Returns:
        an empty sheet ready to receive data

      • createSheet

        public DataSheet createSheet(String[] colNames,
                             boolean forSingleRow,
                             boolean addActionColumn)
        create an empty data sheet based on this record for a subset of fields
        Parameters:
        colNames - subset of column names to be included
        forSingleRow - true if you intend to use this to have just one row
        addActionColumn - should we add a column to have action to be performed on each row
        Returns:
        an empty sheet ready to receive rows of data

      • readMany

        public int readMany(DataSheet inSheet,
                    DataSheet outSheet,
                    DbDriver driver,
                    Value userId)
        read, in our vocabulary, is ALWAYS primary key based read. Hence we expect (at most) one row of output per read. If values has more than one rows, we read for primary key in each row.
        Parameters:
        inSheet - one or more rows that has value for the primary key.
        outSheet - sheet to which rows are to be extracted
        driver -
        userId - we may have a common security strategy to restrict output rows based on user. Not used as of now
        Returns:
        data sheet for sure. With data that is returned by the driver

      • readOne

        public int readOne(FieldsInterface inData,
                   DataSheet outData,
                   DbDriver driver,
                   Value userId)
        read, in our vocabulary, is ALWAYS primary key based read. Hence we expect (at most) one row of output per read. If values has more than one rows, we read for primary key in each row.
        Parameters:
        inData - one or more rows that has value for the primary key.
        outData - sheet to which data is to be extracted into
        driver -
        userId - we may have a common security strategy to restrict output rows based on user. Not used as of now
        Returns:
        number of rows extracted

      • saveOne

        public SaveActionType saveOne(FieldsInterface row,
                              DbDriver driver,
                              Value userId,
                              boolean treatSqlErrorAsNoResult)
        add, modify and delete are the three operations we can do for a record. "save" is a special convenient command. If key is specified, it is assumed to be modify, else add. Save
        Parameters:
        row - data to be saved.
        driver -
        userId -
        treatSqlErrorAsNoResult - if true, we assume that some constraints are set at db level, and sql error is treated as if affected rows is zero
        Returns:
        number of rows saved. -1 in case of batch, and the driver is unable to count the saved rows

      • getReady

        public void getReady()
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Components may have to set-up their shops after loading the attributes. Typically ensuring referential integrity, caching etc.. In case of components having sub-components, it is generally a good idea to have setUp() only for the parent component, from where you may trigger set-up of child components
        Specified by:
        getReady in interface Component
